abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the E-delivery of Public
            Services Development Policy Loan Project for India were as
            follows: outcomes were moderately satisfactory; risk to
            development outcome was moderate; Bank performance was
            moderately satisfactory and borrower performance was also
            moderately satisfactory. Some lessons learned includes:
            India's National e-Governance Plan (NeGP) is a useful
            governance-oriented model for countries modernizing their
            service delivery processes. The citizen-centered approach of
            the NeGP is a vibrant and relevant model for countries or
            sub-national governments which are designing or implementing
            Information and Communication Technology (ICT) reform
            programs. An innovative and creative approach is needed for
            engaging with a sophisticated client like the central
            Government of India. Low-income state engagement is
            well-aligned with the Bank's poverty and shared
            prosperity mission; in the area of e-governance, it is also
            a strategy which reflects a 'good fit' between
            client needs and the Bank's traditional products and
            services. Engagement with the Government is most beneficial
            when it remains focused on substance and flexibility. A
            structured and strategic approach to risk management should
            be considered when programmatic interruption is a
            significant possibility.
